title: 114_s3093
content: The Equity in Career and Technical Education Act of 2016, also known as the Carl D. Perkins Career and Technical Education Act of 2006, aims to support high-quality career and technical education programs that prepare students for college and careers, ensuring the global competitiveness and economic self-sufficiency of the United States. The Equity in Career and Technical Education Act of 2016, also known as the Carl D. Perkins Career and Technical Education Act of 2006, is amended to define the term 'equity gap' as disparities in participation and performance based on gender, race, and special populations in career and technical education programs. The term 'self-sufficiency' in the Equity in Career and Technical Education Act of 2016 is defined as a wage that covers basic needs and allows for future savings. Additionally, the Act includes provisions for necessary services like transportation, child care, and tuition to support participation in career and technical education activities. SEC. 5. Authorization of appropriations amended to cover 2017 through 2021. SEC. 6. Within state allocation, $100,000 reserved for technical assistance and professional development. SEC. 7. Accountability measures implemented. Section 113 (20 U.S.C. 2323) is amended to include provisions for closing equity gaps and improving levels of performance. Section 113 (20 U.S.C. 2323) is amended to include provisions for closing equity gaps and improving levels of performance by addressing progress indicators and recipient accountability. The amendment to Section 113 (20 U.S.C. 2323) includes provisions for closing equity gaps by tracking how funds are used to provide programs and support services, focusing on gender, race, and special populations. The amendment to Section 113 (20 U.S.C. 2323) focuses on closing equity gaps by tracking fund usage for programs and services to support eligible recipients. The amendment to Section 113 (20 U.S.C. 2323) aims to close equity gaps by tracking fund usage for programs and services to support eligible recipients, focusing on gender, race, and special populations. SEC. 8. NATIONAL ACTIVITIES. Section 114(d) (20 U.S.C. 2324(d)) is amended to include individuals with expertise in developing programs that close equity gaps. Additionally, successful programs under this Act must also focus on closing equity gaps through detailed analyses. In amendments to section 113, emphasis is placed on closing equity gaps by providing high-quality programs and detailed analyses. "Amendments to section 121(a) include conducting an equity gap analysis." SEC. 10 amends Section 122(c) to include how funds will support State technical assistance and professional development to close equity gaps. SEC. 11 focuses on State program improvement. Section 123 (20 U.S.C. 2343) is amended to address closing equity gaps identified under section 113(c)(2)(B) for the preceding fiscal year. This includes improving performance levels and closing equity gaps in State programs. Section 123 (20 U.S.C. 2343) is amended to address closing equity gaps by requiring improvement in performance levels for identified populations. This includes showing improvement on closing equity gaps for 3 consecutive years. Subparagraphs are redesignated and added to ensure progress in State programs. An eligible agency must use funds for closing equity gaps if improvement is not shown within the first year of implementation or for 3 consecutive years. Conducting an equity gap analysis is required to ensure progress in State programs. In paragraph (2), adjustments are made to address the closing of equity gaps identified in section 113(b)(4)(C)(ii)(II). In paragraph (4), changes are made to emphasize the importance of closing equity gaps in performance improvement. The text chunk discusses additional requirements for eligible entities to address closing equity gaps for specific populations over 3 consecutive years. The text chunk requires eligible recipients to allocate at least 10 percent of funds to address equity gaps if improvement is not shown within the first year or for 3 consecutive years. SEC. 12. STATE LEADERSHIP ACTIVITIES. Amends Section 124(b) to include delivering professional development and technical assistance to close equity gaps in career assessment. SEC. 13 amends Section 134(b) to focus on closing equity gaps in career and technical education programs. SEC. 14 addresses local uses of funds. SEC. 14 amends Section 135(b) to include effective practices for closing equity gaps in career and technical education programs.
